description: From Late Middle English cubicle, from Latin cubiculum (“bedroom”). Doublet of cubiculum.

entries.meaning: A small separate part or one of the compartments of a room, especially in a work environment.
examples: Most libraries provide cubicles for quiet study.

entries.meaning: A small enclosure at a swimming pool etc. used to provide personal privacy when changing.
(UK, Australia) A small enclosure in a public toilet for individual use.
